column2: Abstract
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=2 left-column left-indent right-indent font-larger column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-abstract headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We propose a new method for reformat-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ting web documents by extracting seman-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tic structures from web pages. Our ap-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: proach is to extract trees that describe hier-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: archical relations in documents. We devel-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: oped an algorithm for this task by employ-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing the EM algorithm and clustering tech-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: niques. Preliminary experiments showed
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that our approach was more effective than
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: baseline methods.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: This paper proposes a novel method for reformat-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ting (i.e., changing visual representations,) of web
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: documents. Our final goal is to implement the sys-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tem that appropriately reformats layouts of web doc-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: uments by separating semantic aspects (like XML)
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from layout aspects (like CSS) of web documents,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and changing the layout aspects while retaining the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: semantic aspects.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We propose a header tree, which is a reasonable
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: choice as a semantic representation of web docu-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments for this goal. Header trees can be seen as vari-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ants of XML trees where each internal node is not an
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: XML tag, but a header which is a part of document
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: that can be regarded as tags annotated to other parts
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the document. Titles, headlines, and attributes are
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: examples of headers. The left part of Figure 1 shows
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: an example web document. In this document, the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: headers are About Me, which is a title, and NAME
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and AGE, which are attributes. (For example, NAME
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can be seen as a tag annotated to John Smith.)
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Figure 2 shows a header tree for the example docu-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ment. It should be noted that each node is labeled
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with parts of HTML pages, not abstract categories
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: such as XML tags.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent box column-top figure-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 1: An Example Web Document and Conver-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: sion from HTML Documents to Block Lists.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Therefore, the required task is to extract header
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: trees from given web documents. Web documents
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: can be reformatted by converting their header trees
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: into various forms including Powerpoint-like in-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dented lists, HTML tables <sup>1</sup> , and Tree-class objects
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column centered right-indent font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of Java. We implemented the system that produces
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: these representations by extracting header trees from
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: given web documents.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: One application of such reformatting is a web
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: browser on small devices that shows extracted
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: header trees regardless of original HTML visual ren-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dering. Trees can be used as compact representa-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions of web documents because they show internal
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: structures of web documents concisely, and they can
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be further augmented with open/close operations on
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: each node for the purpose of closing unnecessary
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: nodes, or sentence summarization on leaf nodes con-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: taining long sentences. Another application is a lay-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: out changer, which change a layout (i.e., HTML tag
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: usage) of one web page to another, by aligning ex-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tracted header trees of two web documents. Other
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: applications include HTML to XML transformation
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and audio-browsable web content (Mukherjee et al.,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma
page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>1</sup> For example, the first column represents the root, the sec-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-super tailchar-hiphen

column2: ond column represents its children, etc.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1.1 Related Work
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Several studies have addressed the problem of ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tracting logical structures from general HTML doc-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: uments without labeled training examples. One
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of these studies used domain-specific knowledge to
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: extract information used to organize logical struc-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tures (Chung et al., 2002). However, their ap-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: proach cannot be applied to domains for which
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: any knowledge is not provided. Another type of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: study employed algorithms to detect repeated pat-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: terns in a list of HTML tags and texts (Yang and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Zhang, 2001; Nanno et al., 2003), or more struc-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tured forms (Mukherjee et al., 2003; Crescenzi et
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: al., 2001; Chang and Lui, 2001) such as DOM
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: trees. This approach might be useful for certain
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: types of web documents, particularly those with
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: highly regular formats such as www.yahoo.com
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and www.amazon.com. However, in many cases,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column centered right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: HTML tag usage does not have so much regularity,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: and, there are even the case where headers do not
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: repeat at all. Therefore, this type of algorithm may
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be inadequate for the task of header extraction from
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: arbitrary web documents.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The remainder of this paper is organized as fol-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: lows. Section 2 defines the terms used in this paper.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Section 3 provides the details of our algorithm. Sec-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion 4 lists the experimental results and Section 5
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concludes this paper.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 Definitions
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2.1 Definition of Terms
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Our system decomposes an HTML document into a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: list of blocks. A block is defined as the part of a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: web document that is separated by a separator. A
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: separator is a sequence of HTML tags and symbols.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Symbols are defined as characters in texts that are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: neither numbers nor letters. Figure 1 shows an ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ample of the conversion of an HTML document to a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: list of blocks.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=1 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: [ [About Me, [NAME, John Smith], [AGE, 25] ], Back to Home
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column centered right-indent font-smallest column-top above-line-space

column2: Page] ]
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail line-space headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 3: A List Representation of the Example Web
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital

column2: Document
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: A header is defined as a block that modifies sub-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: sequent blocks. In other words, a block that can be
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: a tag annotated to subsequent blocks is defined as a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: header. Some examples of headers are Titles (e.g.,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: “About Me”), Headlines (e.g., “Here is my pro-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: file:”), Attributes (e.g., “Name”, “Age”, etc.), and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Dates.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2.2 Definition of the Task
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The system produces header trees for given web
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: documents. A header tree can be seen as an indented
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: list of blocks where the level of each node’s indent
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is equal to the depth of the node, as shown in Figure
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 2. Therefore, the main part of our task is to give a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization

column2: depth to each block in a given web document. After
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that, some heuristic rules are employed to construct
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: header trees from a list of depths. In the next sec-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion, we discuss the task of assigning a depth to each
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: block. Therefore, an input to the system is a list of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: blocks and the output is a list of depths.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The system also produces nested-list representa-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of header trees for the purpose of evaluation. In
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: nested-list representation, each node that has chil-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dren is represented by the list whose first element
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: represents the parent and remaining elements repre-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sent the children. Figure 3 shows list representation
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the tree in Figure 2.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3 Header Extraction Algorithm
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In this section, we describe our algorithm that re-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ceives a list of blocks and returns a list of depths.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.1 Basic Concepts
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The algorithm proceeds in two steps: separator cat-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: egorization and block clustering. The first step
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: estimates local block relations (i.e., relations be-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tween neighboring blocks) via probabilistic models
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for characters and tags that appear around separa-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tors. The second step supplements the first by ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tracting the undetermined relations between blocks
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: by focusing on global features, i.e., regularities in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: HTML tag sequences. We employed a clustering
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: framework to implement a flexible regularity detec-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion system that is robust to noise.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.2 STEP 1: Separator Categorization
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The algorithm classifies each block relation into one
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: of three classes: NON-BOUNDARY, RELATING,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma page-bottom

column2: __Figure 4__
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=-1 left-column right-indent box page-top figure-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 4: An Example of Separator Categorization.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column centered left-indent right-indent longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: and UNRELATING. Both RELATING and UNRE-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: LATING can be considered to be boundaries; how-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ever, blocks that sandwich RELATING separators
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column centered right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: are regarded to consist of a header and its modified
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: block. Figure 4 shows an example of separator cate-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gorization for the list of blocks in Figure 1.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The left block of a RELATING separator must be
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: in the smaller depth than the right block. Figure 2
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: shows an example. In this tree, NAME is in a smaller
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: depth than John. On the other hand, both the left
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and right blocks in a NON-BOUNDARY separator
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: must be in the same depth in a tree representation,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: for example, John and Smith in Figure 2.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.2.1 Local Model
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading3 above-line-space

column2: We use a probabilistic model that assumes the lo-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: cality of relations among separators and blocks. In
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: this model, each separator and the strings around
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it,  and  , are modeled by means of the hidden vari-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: able  , which indicates the class in which is cate-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gorized. We use the character zerogram, unigram, or
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: bigram (changed according to the number of appear-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ances <sup>2</sup> ) for  and  to avoid data sparseness prob-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lems.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: For example, let us consider the following part of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-period above-line-space

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: is defined as             where is a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column centered right-indent font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: vector of left strings,  is a vector of separators, and
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail tailchar-period

column2: The joint probability of obtaining  , , and  is
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space above-double-space above-line-space

column2: assuming that  and  depend only on  : a class of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: relation between the blocks around . <sup>34</sup>
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: <sup>2</sup> This generalization is performed by a heuristic algorithm.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-super tailchar-period

column2: The main idea is to use a bigram if its number of appearances is
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column centered right-indent font-smallest hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: over a threshold, and unigrams or zerograms otherwise.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: <sup>3</sup> If the frequency for     is over a threthold,       is
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent right-indent font-larger indented-line longer-tail headchar-super

column2: used instead of          .
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent font-smaller hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: <sup>4</sup> If the frequency for  is under a threthold,  is replaced by
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-super

column2: its longest prefix whose frequency is over the threthold.

page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: Based on this model, each class of separators is
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent column-top headchar-capital

column2: determined as follows:
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The hidden parameters    ,     , and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: , are estimated by the EM algorithm (Demp-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: ster et al., 1977). Starting with arbitrary initial pa-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rameters, the EM algorithm iterates E-STEPs and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column centered right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: function        M-STEPs in order to increase   the  (log-)likelihood    .
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: To characterize each class of separators, we use a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent indented-line headchar-capital

column2: set of typical symbols and HTML tags, called rep-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: resentatives from each class. This constraint con-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tributes to give a structure to the parameter space.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.3 STEP 2: Block Clustering
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-line-space

column2: The purpose of block clustering is to take advantage
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: of the regularity in visual representations. For exam-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ple, we can observe regularity between NAME and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: AGE in Figure 1 because both are sandwiched by the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: character * and preceded by a null line. This visual
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: representation is described in the HTML source as,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: for example,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-comma above-line-space

column2:
...

* NAME *
...
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line longer-tail line-space tailchar-period
page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Our idea is to define the similarities between (con-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: text of) blocks based on the similarities between
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: their surrounding separators. Each separator is rep-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: resented by the vector that consist of symbols and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: HTML tags included in it, and the similarity be-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tween separators are calculated as cosine values.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The algorithm proceeds in a bottom-up manner by
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: examining a given block list from tail to head, find-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing the block that is the most similar to the current
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: block, and collecting them into the same cluster. Af-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ter that, all blocks in the same cluster is assigned the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: same depth.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4 Preliminary Experiments
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We used a training data that consists of 1,418 web
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: documents <sup>5</sup> of moderate file size 6 that did not have
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column centered right-indent font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: “src” or “script” tags <sup>7</sup> . The former criteria is based
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column centered right-indent font-largest aligned-line

column2: on the observation that too small or too large doc-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: uments are hard to use for measuring performance
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of algorithms, and the latter criteria is caused by the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: fact our system currently has no module to handle
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: image files as blocks.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We randomly selected 20 documents as test doc-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: uments. Each test document was bracketed by hand
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>5</sup> They are collected by retrieving all user pages on one server
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent right-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: of a Japanese ISP.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: <sup>6</sup> from 1,000 to 10,000 bytes
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-super

column2: <sup>7</sup> Src tags indicate inclusion of image files, java codes, etc
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line longer-tail headchar-super page-bottom

column2: Table 1: Macro-Averaged Recall, Precision, and F-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: measure on Test Documents
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: to evaluate machine-made bracketings. The per-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: formance of web-page structuring algorithms can
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be evaluated via the nested-list form of tree by
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: bracketed recall and bracketed precision (Goodman,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: 1996). Recall is the rate that bracketing given by
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line year

column2: hand are also given by machine, and precision is the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: rate that bracketing given by machine are also given
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: by hand. F-measure is a harmonic mean of recall and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: precision that is used as a combined measure. Recall
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and precision were evaluated for each test document
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and they were averaged across all test documents.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: These averaged values are called macro-average re-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: call, precision, and f-measure (Yang, 1999).
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We implemented our algorithm and the following
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: three ones as baselines.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: NO-CL does not perform block clustering.

column2: NO-EM does not perform the EM-parameter-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: estimation. Every boundary but representatives
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower

column2: is defined to be categorized as “UNRELAT-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ING”.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: PREV performs neither the EM-learning nor the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column centered right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: block clustering. Every boundary but represen-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tatives is defined to be categorized as “NON-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: BOUNDARY” <sup>8</sup> . It uses the heuristics that “ev-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent right-indent font-largest aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ery block depends on its previous block.”
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 1 shows the result. We observed that use of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: both the EM-learning and block clustering resulted
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: among the three baselines. It suggests that only rely-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing on HTML tag information is not a so bad strat-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Results on the documents that were rich in HTML
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: tags with highly coherent layouts were better than
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: those on the others like the documents with poor
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: separators such as only one space character or one
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: line feed. Some of the current results on the doc-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: uments with such poor visual cues seemed difficult

column2: This paper proposed a method for reformatting web
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-over aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: documents by extracting header trees that give hi-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erarchical structures of web documents. Prelimi-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nary experiments showed that the proposed algo-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rithm was effective compared with some baseline
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: methods. However, the performance of the algo-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rithm on some of the test documents was not suf-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ficient for practical use. We plan to improve the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-over aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen
